qas.question: What type of boat design was first invented during the Han era?
In what areas were Han ships able to be sailed in part due to the stern rudder?
What ship design contained a flat-bottomed hull?
What type of transport was the steering oar most likely to be used during?

context: The Han-era Chinese sailed in a variety of ships differing from those of previous eras, such as the tower ship. <a0_0>The junk design<a0_0/> was developed and realized during Han. <a2_0>Junks<a2_0/> featured a square-ended bow and stern, a flat-bottomed hull or carvel-shaped hull with no keel or sternpost, and solid transverse bulkheads in the place of structural ribs found in Western vessels. Moreover, Han ships were the first in the world to be steered using a rudder at the stern, in contrast to the simpler steering oar used for <a3_0>riverine transport<a3_0/>, allowing them to sail on the <a1_0>high seas<a1_0/>.
